name: The House at the end of Bleeker Street
name_original: The House at the end of Bleeker Street
description:
It stood alone at the very end of the road, far past where the street had turned from the familiar black and yellow hardtop into gravely dirt. The vine-covered, wooden-paneled, slanted house stood with an alluring force that you had tried for so long to ignore. But, with your presence at its front door, you know that you have failed. You could try to convince yourself that you’re just taking a quick peek. Just a small gander at the neighborhood spook. But you know better than to kid yourself. You’re here to finally go inside this wretched building and claim its many, many secrets as your own.

The House at the end of Bleeker Street is a sprawling narrative adventure played from the perspective of a child.

Throughout your journey, you will discover secrets and hints left by dozens of children who have since disappeared. These hints will guide you on your quest to find the entities responsible for the operation of The House. Occasionally, these hints will be tricks left by the malignant forces controlling the house. These tricks will mislead the player into attempting dangerous or unrelated activities in order to stop them from discovering The House’s secrets.

This was a final project for HPU's Narrative Design Course.

Katie Pearson - Narrative Design, Art Design & Character Design

Matt Boyer - Narrative Design, Implementation, & Graphic Design

Ross Woods - Narrative Design
